{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3129541,"name":"Alex","username":"ahaltom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ahaltom/{size}/219362_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T04:06:53.126Z","cooked":"

Here is a exciting project our programming team has been working on. The robot is able to dynamically generate a path to a specific end point and avoid game elements along the way. In the video, the driver holds down a button then the path is generated and followed.

Many technologies are in use here:

  • Path planner on the fly path generation
  • Visibility graphs
  • Obstacle avoidance
  • A* path generation
  • April tags
  • Photonvision

Also, thanks to Team 6328 Mechanical Advantage for these tools:

  • AdvantageKit & AdvantageScope

We are looking forward to a great 2023 season!

This is really cool! Looking into adding stuff like this to PPLib next year so glad to see it seems to work well before I try to implement it myself.

Does the “obstacle avoidance” you mentioned just mean that you avoid field elements or does it take vision measurements into account, say, for avoiding other robots?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T15:18:52.453Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":760,"readers_count":759,"score":252.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/2","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129707,"name":"Cr1spyBacon8r","username":"Cr1spyBacon8r","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cr1spybacon8r/{size}/139984_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T15:22:07.306Z","cooked":"

Right now we only have it set up to avoid field elements, but we’ve definitely thought about robot avoidance as well.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T15:22:07.306Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":714,"readers_count":713,"score":217.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Cr1spyBacon8r","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33850,"username":"mjansen4857","name":"Michael Jansen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27727,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3129793,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T16:26:31.126Z","cooked":"

To add to this, the main limiting factor is sensors. From my understanding, the code supports dynamic obstacles, but we don’t have enough experience with Scanning LIDAR/Video Object Detection to reliably detect the actual locations of other robots at this point.

That’s awesome! How does Photon play into this demo? Localization stuff I presume?

We’re using it for our positioning with April Tags. Definitely helps to keep the robot thinking it’s where it actually is.

Looks really nice! What resolution and heuristics are you using for the visibility graph and the A*?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T00:13:27.432Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":487,"readers_count":486,"score":157.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Tomer1577","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":27727,"username":"Cr1spyBacon8r","name":"Cr1spyBacon8r","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cr1spybacon8r/{size}/139984_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30679,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130197,"name":"Benjamin","username":"THRYLLR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T00:58:30.807Z","cooked":"

A few weeks ago I started implementing something very similar to this, also using A*. I was told by members of the FRC community that my idea would not be super effective as A* is a shortest-path algorithm which wouldn’t work well in a situation dependent on speed and power (like a robotics match). Are you using some sort of different method of measuring shortest-path data?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T00:58:30.807Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":467,"readers_count":466,"score":223.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Benjamin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56545,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4669 former Design/Leadership"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/8","custom_user_title":"4669 former Design/Leadership","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130200,"name":"Joe Lockwood","username":"joeojazz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joeojazz/{size}/193359_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T01:00:46.268Z","cooked":"

We originally where using A* in a grid which would require a resolution and heuristic. However a big reason for switching to a Visibility Graph is your heuristic is your distance between nodes and there is no resolution limit. For the sake of this example that we made. We only needed 5 nodes and one Obstacle added. If you would like to see our A* code here is the link.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T01:10:06.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":442,"readers_count":441,"score":158.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Joe Lockwood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Hemlock5712/swerve-test/blob/5837de688bea65efd98d58f4bd103a8c5686ee65/src/main/java/frc/robot/pathfind/VisGraph.java#L61:~:text=public%20List%3CNode%3E%20findPath(Node%20start%2C%20Node%20goal)%20%7B","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"swerve-test/VisGraph.java at 5837de688bea65efd98d58f4bd103a8c5686ee65 · Hemlock5712/swerve-test · GitHub","clicks":112}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30679,"username":"Tomer1577","name":"Tomer1577","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/d9b06d/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26945,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5712 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/9","custom_user_title":"5712 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130201,"name":"Joe Lockwood","username":"joeojazz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joeojazz/{size}/193359_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T01:04:25.541Z","cooked":"

No we are using A*. However because we are using a Visibility Graph there are very few point needed to be searched in the A* algorithm. We also are creating our Visibility Graph (of all know points other than starting location) on boot up. When we want to start following a path we add a new node (current location) and connect it to other nodes it can reach. This simplifies and cuts down the time significantly.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T01:04:25.541Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":420,"readers_count":419,"score":139.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Joe Lockwood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56545,"username":"THRYLLR","name":"Benjamin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e19b73/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26945,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5712 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/10","custom_user_title":"5712 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130207,"name":"Benjamin","username":"THRYLLR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T01:10:13.831Z","cooked":"

It never occurred to me to generate a graph based around visibility like that! My implementation also uses a grid, and to circumvent all the resolution issues associated with grids, I wrote a function which basically removes all path vertices if doing so doesn’t create obstacle collisions. It‘s pretty inefficient.

What I was told by a few people is that generating robot trajectories optimized for distance rather than speed isn’t the best idea for something like FRC; are you somehow optimizing your generated trajectories for time?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T01:10:13.831Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":401,"readers_count":400,"score":105.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Benjamin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26945,"username":"joeojazz","name":"Joe Lockwood","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joeojazz/{size}/193359_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56545,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4669 former Design/Leadership"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/11","custom_user_title":"4669 former Design/Leadership","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130222,"name":"Joe Lockwood","username":"joeojazz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joeojazz/{size}/193359_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T01:31:53.848Z","cooked":"

Yes, we have a way to add weights between specific nodes. For example, this year, we plan to implement this over the charging station. We would modify the cost (usually the distance) by factoring in the terrain (how it is not flat) and the speed our robot is traveling over said terrain (we don’t plan to drive full speed over the charging stations). Of course, adding weights is not automatic and would require some tuning. But it is our solution to optimize our generated trajectories.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T01:31:53.848Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":371,"readers_count":370,"score":104.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Joe Lockwood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56545,"username":"THRYLLR","name":"Benjamin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e19b73/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26945,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5712 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/12","custom_user_title":"5712 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130232,"name":"Benjamin","username":"THRYLLR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T01:40:04.399Z","cooked":"

Probably a stupid question, but how do you plan on keeping odometry accurate while on the tilted charging station? I’ve used encoder-based odometry in the past, and I don’t fully understand how it would stay accurate on sloped surfaces. Would you be correcting it with AprilTag pose estimation or something?

If anyone is looking into this, and has questions about alternate algorithms or implementation details, I am the lead programmer of another team in the local area of 5712, and helped them with this. I also looked into 10+ papers about different algorithms for this. I also have looked into different ways of generating graphs. Feel free to contact me here (I wonder if I can hook up Chief for notifications, just made this account) or on Discord (my GitHub is the same as this account name and I’m in the Photonvision and FRC discord).

Are there any thoughts on expanding this to an RRT* type implementation? I think the regeneration could potentially be difficult with moving objects (robots) and become computationally intensive, but potentially with a more built-out solution, you could only regenerate parts.

Does this expand to when you want to traverse to another point though? Or would RRT* be more advantageous because you have so many other nodes/trajectories you can use when navigating elsewhere? That way you wouldn’t have to recompute for every new trajectory. Regardless that thing is crazy cool.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":28,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T14:26:40.127Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":56.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423818,"topic_slug":"dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video","display_username":"Henry Mahnke","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49561,"username":"Ashray.g","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ashray.g/{size}/194161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49605,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/dynamic-on-the-fly-path-generation-in-teleop-video/423818/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131219,"name":"Joe Lockwood","username":"joeojazz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joeojazz/{size}/193359_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T14:45:59.333Z","cooked":"

So I have several thought on this. @JCodeShelver may think differently, but I’ll give you my thoughts about moving objects (robots).

Moving objects are complex. Not only do you have to account for where they are, but if you want it to work well, you would need to account for where they are going. As for switching to RRT*.

  1. We found A* to work better than RRT* (it was faster). Once again, this is in the way we have it implemented.
  2. The slowest part is generating the spline for the robot to follow. So switching to RRT* would not help.

Now, this is only for our application. There may be a clever way to get RRT* to work with moving obstacles, but as that is not our goal this year, overall, a Visibility Graph with A* worked better.

Can you get it to work the way we have it set up? Short answer yes, long answer no.

To avoid robots, you should start with your standard nodes programmed in before the match. Something like this

image934×823 17 KB

You then would add a robot as an obstacle and dynamically add nodes to avoid the robot.

image1237×1102 40.6 KB

You would be better off switching to a different algorithm at this point. @JCodeShelver probably knows of one that would work better.

I want to add one thing we hoped for this year: we could develop a solution that runs off the Rio.

This year, all pathfinding and path generation are done on the Rio. So this season, we will be focused on perfecting this (with no robot avoidance) and hopefully coming up with a solution that other teams can reasonably implement.

Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131264,"name":"James","username":"JCodeShelver","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a8b319/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T16:12:43.632Z","cooked":"

I agree on these points. I personally also don’t like RRT* since it has no completeness guarantee. From the theoretical perspective, this is unsettling. There are many descendants of RRT* that are faster than RRT*, so if you were to implement it, I’d recommend looking into its Wikipedia page and around online for papers that show better alternatives. Because the final goal is to follow a smooth path from A to B, the most optimal algorithm would probably be a 5D one, that takes into account x,y,theta,and two other constraints I don’t recall that actually account for the robot’s kinematics. This would result in states that you’d follow with a hand-coded following program most likely using multiple PID (and maybe some feedforward in there) controllers. Also, since recalculation of paths in our case occurs if and only if some event stops the path mid way (the robot is knocked off course by another robot for example) resulting in the re-execution of the entire program that makes the path from current position to the end point, we’ll already be closer to the target, so the entire search and the spline generation is shorter.
